name: GetSenderList
description:
Retrieve a list of senders from your workspace.

This tool retrieves a list of senders in your workspace, representing the identities from which messages are sent. Use this to manage or display sender information.

parameters.name: pagination_token
parameters.description: Token for the page of results to return. Use the `next` property from the response for pagination.

value_schema.description: The token for the page of results you want to return. Responses contain a `next` property. Use this property as the `start` value to return the next page of results.

parameters.name: max_results_per_page
parameters.description: The maximum number of sender results to retrieve per page. Specify an integer value.

value_schema.description: The maximum number of results you want to retrieve per page.

parameters.name: results_sort_order
parameters.description: Sort results: 'asc' for chronological, 'desc' for reverse chronological order.

value_schema.description: Determine how you want to sort results, `asc` for chronological order and `desc` for reverse chronological order.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Customer.io App API

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: The token for the page of results you want to return. Responses contain a `next` property. Use this property as the `start` value to return the next page of results.

value_schema.description: The token for the page of results you want to return. Responses contain a `next` property. Use this property as the `start` value to return the next page of results.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results you want to retrieve per page.

value_schema.description: The maximum number of results you want to retrieve per page.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Determine how you want to sort results, `asc` for chronological order and `desc` for reverse chronological order.

value_schema.description: Determine how you want to sort results, `asc` for chronological order and `desc` for reverse chronological order.
